I have been fascinated by human behavior and studying such for two months already. It brought me to interesting paths of empathy towards people that caused me great harm and also reflected a lot with how I handled my decisions in the past. But another thing that strikes me the most about human behavior is that our human capacity to coordinate with each other to create chaos against groups of people to whom we are not affiliated with… our capacity to start and implement wars..

Wars are one of the best and worst tools ever wielded by humanity. We are one of the few animals who can band into groups and destroy other groups of people

No one can escape the strands of impact wars have caused. Everyone in this world have been forged over 3.6 million years of war starting from our primal ancestors trying to stay alive to warlords carving their swords and spears to become momentary Gods of multiple lands.

Genghis Khan is one of the few of us who have changed the path of history - using war as a tool to implement his own aspirations for the world to follow. His influence in history is immense, to name such:

  • Co-existence of different cultures and religions
  • Genocide
  • Silk Road
